description: A factory produces two products A and B. Product A yields $5 profit per unit and product B yields $4 profit per unit. Each unit of A requires 2 hours of labor and 1 unit of raw material. Each unit of B requires 1 hour of labor and 2 units of raw material. The factory has 100 hours of labor and 80 units of raw material available. Maximize total profit.

ProfitA.definition: Profit per unit of product A

ProfitB.definition: Profit per unit of product B

LaborPerA.definition: Labor hours required per unit of A

MaterialPerA.definition: Raw material required per unit of A

LaborPerB.definition: Labor hours required per unit of B

MaterialPerB.definition: Raw material required per unit of B

objective.description: "The goal is to maximize the total profit from producing products A and B in the factory"

constraints.description: Total labor hours used for products A and B should not exceed the total available labor hours
Total raw material used for products A and B should not exceed the total available raw material
The number of units produced for product A should be greater than or equal to 0
The number of units produced for product B should be greater than or equal to 0

unitsA.definition: The number of units produced for product A

unitsB.definition: The number of units produced for product B
